performance_metrics.name: Test Execution Time per Test Suite
performance_metrics.description: Average time taken to execute all tests within a specific test suite. Lower values indicate greater efficiency.

performance_metrics.name: Test Coverage (%)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of code lines, branches, and paths covered by automated tests.  A higher percentage indicates greater confidence in the software's quality.

performance_metrics.name: Test Pass Rate (%)
performance_metrics.description: Percentage of tests that successfully pass. This reflects the stability and reliability of the automated tests.

performance_metrics.name: Test Suite Execution Time (Overall)
performance_metrics.description: Total time required to execute all test suites within a defined testing cycle. Dependent on test suite size and number of suites.

performance_metrics.name: Report Generation Time
performance_metrics.description: Time taken to generate comprehensive test reports after execution.

performance_metrics.name: Throughput (Tests/Hour)
performance_metrics.description: Number of tests that can be executed per hour.  Determined by system capacity and test suite design.

implementation_requirements.name: Test Automation Framework
implementation_requirements.specification: Modular, Object-Oriented, with support for Page Object Model, Data-Driven Testing, and Keyword-Driven Testing.
implementation_requirements.description: Framework should facilitate reusable components, maintainability, and scalability.

implementation_requirements.name: Test Environment Configuration
implementation_requirements.specification: Dedicated virtual machines (VMs) - Minimum 4 VMs per test team, each with 16GB RAM, 8 CPU cores, 500GB SSD storage.  Staging environment mirroring production.
implementation_requirements.description: Ensures consistent and reliable test execution.

implementation_requirements.name: Test Data Management
implementation_requirements.specification: Data masking, synthetic data generation, and integration with a data warehouse for realistic test data.
implementation_requirements.description: Maintaining data security and privacy while providing relevant test data.

implementation_requirements.name: Version Control Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: Tight integration with Git for code and test scripts.

implementation_requirements.name: Continuous Integration/Continuous Delivery (CI/CD) Integration
implementation_requirements.specification: Seamless integration with CI/CD pipelines (e.g., Jenkins, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps). Automated test execution as part of the pipeline.
implementation_requirements.description: Enables rapid feedback and faster release cycles.

implementation_requirements.name: Reporting & Analytics
implementation_requirements.specification: Real-time dashboards displaying test coverage, pass/fail rates, and trends. Integration with BI tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).

industry_standards: NIST SP 800-53 (Security and Privacy Controls for Information Systems)
operational_considerations: Test Team Skillset: Requires expertise in programming languages (Java, Python, JavaScript), automation frameworks, and testing methodologies.
Maintenance Overhead: Ongoing maintenance of test scripts, framework updates, and environment configurations.
Test Data Strategy: Development and implementation of a robust test data management strategy.
Risk Assessment: Identifying and mitigating potential risks associated with automation, such as script failures and environmental issues.
Scalability Planning: Designing the automation infrastructure to accommodate future growth and increasing test coverage.
Change Management: Implementing a change management process for updates to the automation framework and test scripts.
Collaboration: Establishing clear communication channels between the test team, developers, and business stakeholders.
